All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
Battlescreen
Battlescreen, where two players shoot at each others' ships
Board
implements a game Board for battleships this includes, a field that stores the position of the users ships, a field that signifies where the opponent has already shot and a field that signifies where the user has already shot at
Bot
Bot is a subclass of NetworkPlayer that acts like a client object and also generates the responsible answers
Client
Client is a subclass of NetworkPlayer that is used to act as the Client of the Network connection
Coordinate
implements a simple Coordinate class consisting of a x and a y integer
EndGameDialog
 
Game
the Game class uses a Board object to implement the games logic, controls the turn order of the player and is used to process the communication with the opponent
Game_instructions
Screen where the user can read the game instructions and learn about shortcuts.
Gamescreen
Gamescreen, where the previously selcted user ships are being placed on the game board
Hostscreen
Screen in multiplayer mode, where you can choose as a host to start a new game or load an old game.
Joinscreen
Screen in multiplayer mode, where the player can join a game by entering the appropriate IP address.
Joinwaitscreen
Screen, where the player is waiting for the host to start a game.
Mainframe
Main window, which contains every screen of the game
Multiplayer
Screen in Multiplayer mode, where you can decide whether to join a game or host a game
NetworkPlayer
NetworkPlayer is an abstract upper class for the network communication
Pregamescreen
Screen for adjusting game settings in multiplayer mode.
Pregamescreen2
Screen for adjusting game settings in singleplayer mode.
QuitConfirmDialog
Pop-up dialog, when the user is trying to exit the game
RoundButton
A customized version of the JButton.
RoundSpinner
Modern JSpinner in glass design with rounded corners.
RoundTextField
Customized version of the JTextField.
SaveGameDialog
Pop-up dialog, when user saves the game
Server
Server is a subclass of NetworkPlayer that is used to act as the host of the Network connection
Settingsscreen
Screen where the user can change the settings.
Ship
implements a singular Ship
Singleplayer
Screen in singleplayer mode, where you can load a game or create a new one.
SquareGridPanel
 
Titlescreen
Player can choose between single player and multiplayer.
Waitingscreen
Screen in multiplayer mode, where the player is waiting for the joining player.
